page.title: 17HOSPITAL 2
page.content:
{WINESTEAD HOSPITAL}
The Occupational Therapy Unit contains facilities for painting and teaching patients to feed themselves. The more severely physically and mentally handicapped do not spend such long periods in the Occupational Therapy Unit. Some patients go horse riding and swimming for which trophies have been won. In winter there are film shows on Saturday mornings. Frequent outings and holidays are arranged. On outings there would be 2 staff to 8 patients, but on holidays the ratio would be 4 staff to 8 patients. Holidays are taken in Morecambe, Scarborough and Settle. This summer some are going camping under canvas. The League of Friends purchased a 12 seater bus for outings of this kind.
